net.casper.data.model

Interface CBuilder


  • public interface CBuilder
    Interface specifying elements required to build a CDataCacheContainer. These methods may be implemented to build a CDataCacheContainer from any source, e.g.: file, JDBC data source, user interface etc.
    Version:
    $Revision: 125 $
    Author:
    Oliver Mannion

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the data builder source.
      String[] getColumnNames()
      Column names of the built dataset.
      Class[] getColumnTypes()
      Column types of the built dataset.
      Map getConcreteMap()
      Map used to store container rows.
      String getName()
      Name of the built dataset.
      String[] getPrimaryKeyColumns()
      Primary key columns of the built dataset.
      void open()
      Initialisation before building begins.
      Object[] readRow()
      Returns row one at time until dataset built.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Name of the built dataset.
        Returns:
        String

      • getColumnNames

        String[] getColumnNames()
        Column names of the built dataset.
        Returns:
        String[]

      • getColumnTypes

        Class[] getColumnTypes()
        Column types of the built dataset.
        Returns:
        Class[]

      • getPrimaryKeyColumns

        String[] getPrimaryKeyColumns()
        Primary key columns of the built dataset.
        Returns:
        String[]

      • getConcreteMap

        Map getConcreteMap()
        Map used to store container rows.
        Returns:
        Map

      • open

        void open()
          throws IOException
        Initialisation before building begins. Called once before getting cacheName, columnNames, columnTypes and primaryKeyColumns and before readRow(). Useful for initialisation that relies on (optional) parameters that may be set after construction.
        Throws:
        IOException - if export destination cannot be opened.

      • readRow

        Object[] readRow()
                 throws IOException
        Returns row one at time until dataset built. Returns null to indicate no more rows are to be built.
        Returns:
        Object[] row
        Throws:
        IOException - if problem reading row.

      • close

        void close()
        Close the data builder source. This is called after all rows are read, or if there an exception occurs during readRow().
        Throws:
        IOException
